Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: massive ornamental pipe organ

Rising to great heights in the northeastern narthex of the cathedral is a massive, heavily ornamented pipe organ with numerous ranks of lead pipes housed within an engraved gilt framework of ebony wood that encases the top of the feature in decorative coronets. At the base, a carved wooden pedestal illustrates an illuminated scene of the Annunciation, Mary's form bowed down before that of the Archangel Gabriel. The features of these forms are brushed in hues of gold against the ebony wood. Beneath this scene, the dual manuals rest within a small niche, accompanied by a narrow bench that allows the player to manipulate the pedal clavier while operating the keyed manuals easily.

Rising to great heights in the northeastern narthex of the cathedral is a massive, heavily ornamented pipe organ with numerous ranks of lead pipes housed within an engraved gilt framework of ebony wood that encases the top of the feature in decorative coronets. At the base, a carved wooden pedestal illustrates an illuminated scene of the Annunciation, Mary's form bowed down before that of the Archangel Gabriel. The features of these forms are brushed in hues of gold against the ebony wood. Beneath this scene, the dual manuals rest within a small niche, accompanied by a narrow bench that allows the player to manipulate the pedal clavier while operating the keyed manuals easily.
crimson velvet and gilt ebony bench
A narrow crimson velvet and gilt ebony bench set before the pipe organ allows the player to easily manipulate the pedal clavier while operating the keyed manuals.
the pedal clavier of a massive ornamental pipe organ

Resting near the floor at the base of the pipe organ's pedestal is a pedal clavier that allows the player to adjust the various stops responsible for the pipe organ's tone with their feet while simultaneously playing the keys of the dual manuals.
one of the black keys of a massive ornamental pipe organ

The manuals, or keyboards, of the pipe organ are staggered one above the other, each featuring black and white keys used to play the notes in the respective ranks and pipes of the organ towering overhead. The black keys are smaller and nestled between longer white keys, each trio of keys arranged side by side across the lower and upper manual.
one of the white keys of a massive ornamental pipe organ

The manuals, or keyboards, of the pipe organ are staggered one above the other, each featuring black and white keys used to play the notes in the respective ranks and pipes of the organ towering overhead. The black keys are smaller and nestled between longer white keys, each trio of keys arranged side by side across the lower and upper manual.
the black keys of a massive ornamental pipe organ's manuals

The manuals, or keyboards, of the pipe organ are staggered one above the other, each featuring black and white keys used to play the notes in the respective ranks and pipes of the organ towering overhead. The black keys are smaller and nestled between longer white keys, each trio of keys arranged side by side across the lower and upper manual.
the white keys of a massive ornamental pipe organ's manuals

The manuals, or keyboards, of the pipe organ are staggered one above the other, each featuring black and white keys used to play the notes in the respective ranks and pipes of the organ towering overhead. The black keys are smaller and nestled between longer white keys, each trio of keys arranged side by side across the lower and upper manual.
the lower manual of a massive ornamental pipe organ

The manuals, or keyboards, of the pipe organ are staggered one above the other, each featuring black and white keys used to play the notes in the respective ranks and pipes of the organ towering overhead.
the upper manual of a massive ornamental pipe organ

The manuals, or keyboards, of the pipe organ are staggered one above the other, each featuring black and white keys used to play the notes in the respective ranks and pipes of the organ towering overhead.
massive ornamental pipe organ's pedestal

At the base of the pipe organ, a carved wooden pedestal illustrates an illuminated scene of the Annunciation, Mary's form bowed down before that of the Archangel Gabriel. The features of these forms are brushed in hues of gold against the ebony wood. The framework of gilt ebony rises around the ranks of the organ before culminating in ornamental coronets at the top.
one of the lead pipes of a massive ornamental pipe organ

A seemingly innumerable collection of hollow pipes crafted from lead span the full width of the cathedral's narthex wall, the shortest and narrowest in the fore with the tallest and widest in the rear.
the lead pipes of a massive ornamental pipe organ

A seemingly innumerable collection of hollow pipes crafted from lead span the full width of the cathedral's narthex wall, the shortest and narrowest in the fore with the tallest and widest in the rear.
small music stand
A small music stand sits over the upper manual of the pipe organ, the small rail holding the sheets in place at eye-level with the player.
